alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 7:01PM EDT until May 21 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OXFORD...WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND NORTHERN COOS COUNTIES... At 700 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 19 miles northwest of Coburn Gore to 9 miles north of Pittsburg to 19 miles west of Stratford, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Colebrook, Eustis, Coburn Gore, Rangeley, Errol, Pittsburg, Dixville, Stratford, Grafton, Columbia, Dallas Plantation, Dummer, Clarksville, Upper Cupsuptic, Tim Pond, Davis, Lynchtown, Alder Stream, Upton and Chain Of Ponds. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
